summary: This document is an email chain from November 2021 between a Senior Paralegal at FedEx's legal department and an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York. The emails discuss the authentication of FedEx records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, and the identification of a records custodian who could testify at Maxwell's upcoming trial.

persons.name: Tracy
persons.role: Senior Paralegal, Litigation at FedEx Express
persons.context: FedEx employee corresponding with a federal prosecutor to authenticate shipping records and arrange for a records custodian to testify in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the criminal trial for which the FedEx records are being authenticated; the emails are part of the prosecution's evidence gathering.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier; the FedEx records being sought are associated with him, as indicated by the prosecutor's inquiry.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Federal prosecutor from the Southern District of New York leading the correspondence to obtain authenticated FedEx records for the Maxwell trial.

connections.description: Prosecutor requesting assistance from FedEx paralegal to authenticate records and secure a witness for trial.
Both are named as subjects of the FedEx records search, indicating their association in the context of the investigation.
Prosecutor is gathering evidence for the criminal trial against Maxwell.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Scheduled
events.description: The trial of Ghislaine Maxwell is mentioned as scheduled to start in New York in November 2021.

events.title: SDNY Subpoena to FedEx
events.description: Reference to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida sending a subpoena to FedEx in February 2008 for records.

events.title: Request for Records Custodian
events.description: The prosecutor emails Tracy requesting identification of a FedEx records custodian to sign an affidavit and potentially testify at Maxwell's trial.

locations: 3620 Hacks Cross Road Building B 3rd Floor Memphis, TN 38125
1 Saint Andrews Plaza New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively gathering FedEx shipping records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell in mid-2021 for Maxwell's upcoming trial.
A FedEx Senior Paralegal confirmed the authenticity of the records and was coordinating to have a records custodian testify at trial.
The email chain reveals a prior 2008 subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida to FedEx for records, indicating a long-standing investigative interest.
The correspondence shows procedural steps in evidence authentication for a federal criminal trial, specifically seeking a witness to testify about business records.
